page.title: 01Corrie Burn to Merkland
page.content: This area is a National Scenic Area and much of the land is owned by the National Trust for Scotland. Coire Lan is in the North, and from here the Corie burn flows down to the sea. Alongside the north side of the burn is a foootpath leading to the summit of Goalfell. Some of the land is owned by the Forestry commission, and the southern slopes of Mool Donn are uder coniferous plantations. The road (A841) runs along the coast and passes a very few houses-some of which are set back off the road. There is also a licenced restaurant - called "Pirates Cove" - and although it is not much frequented by islanders, it is poular with visitors. There are two main cragy outcrops here, on the northern slopes of both Mool Donn and Meall Breac. The coastal area is a raised beach.
